data.ptitle: Nomination Pool Incentives - Fixing an issue with Motion 339
data.summary: This referendum aims to reward high quality nomination pools using a fair evaluation system. The evaluation system looked at specific criteria such as metadata, verified identity and nominees. An open-source tool was used to analyze the pools and the results were posted for public scrutiny.
data.task1: Reward 22 high quality nomination pools with 250DOT each and reward Polkagate with 250 DOT as well for developing the tool

data.ptitle: Funded High Performance Public Infrastructure for the entire Polkadot Ecosystem
data.summary: With a proven track record of supporting 68 networks in the Polkadot/Kusama ecosystems, OnFinality aims to provide a basic RPC API service for all 38 Polkadot parachains. The proposal seeks to address the divide between well-funded parachains and struggling newcomers by ensuring universal access to reliable, performant, and SLA-supported RPC API endpoints. OnFinality suggests an immediate solution until a long-term infrastructure bounty is established, emphasizing the importance of supporting all parachains to foster network growth and developer adoption.
data.task1: Cover the costs for 38 parachains with RPC API provision by allocating $620.

data.ptitle: Maintenance for the substrate-api-client Sep-23 to Dec-23
data.summary: The proposal seeks funding for the maintenance of the substrate-api-client until December 23. It emphasizes the importance of the library for the Polkadot ecosystem and outlines plans for staying up to date, providing user support, and implementing small improvements. Supercomputing Systems AG, will publish their work under the Apache 2 license and will provide updates until December 31, 2023. Monthly reports will be shared on Polkassembly and be announced in the Polkadot Direction channel on matrix.
data.task1: Provide maintance to the Substrate - api - client library which includes updates, user support, and small improvements.

data.ptitle: Polkadot System Parachain Collators - Tips - Referenda #151 failed to execute
data.summary: This proposal aims to support collators of the Polkadot System Parachains by providing funding for their operational expenses over a two-month period. It addresses the issue of minimal rewards for collators and proposes a short-term solution until a more sustainable model is established. The proposal outlines the operational costs, including hosting and maintenance, as well as staking rewards for permissionless collators.
data.task1: Reward 20 collators of the Polkadot System Parachains for 2 month operational expenses. The tip amount varies from 59-512 $DOT.

data.ptitle: Maintenance & Support Python Libraries (April to September 2023)
data.summary: Polkascan Foundation seeks retroactive funding for maintaining vital Python libraries essential for Polkadot, Kusama, and Substrate-based chains from April to September 2023. Their work includes implementing new features like extensions for Polkascan Explorer and Subsquid, enhancing runtime interfaces, adding support for ink! v4, and updating metadata documentation. This proposal benefits over 265 GitHub repositories and 21 Python packages dependent on their libraries.
data.task1: Implemented new Polkascan Explorer and Subsquid extensions to the py-substrate-interface extension framework.
data.task2: New runtime interface: more intuitive approach to interface with the runtime functionality.
data.task4: Added SCALE type definitions for upcoming MetadataV15 in Substrate.
data.task5: Added multiple params as key support for query_map().
data.task6: Add support for runtime calls at other blocks than the most recent #346.
data.task7: Upgrade contract interface to support WeightV2 #337.
data.task8: Updated metadata docs for Polkadot & Kusama parachain and stand-alone runtimes.
data.task9: Technical support on Github and in #polkascan:matrix.org and substrate.stackexchange.com channels.

data.ptitle: A French content hub for Polkadot Ecosystem
data.summary: This proposal aims to establish a French content hub to address the lack of Polkadot related content and overall engagement in the French-speaking community. It includes activities such as weekly and monthly newsletters, Twitter Spaces, articles, and LinkedIn promotions. The goal is to increase awareness and participation in the Polkadot ecosystem by providing regular updates, facilitating discussions, and leveraging partnerships with French media outlets. Patrice Vibert, the proposer, brings expertise in content creation and philosophy, with a track record of organizing community events and technical writing.
data.task1: Create 44 weekly newsletter by mail on governance.
data.task2: Produce 10 monthly newsletters by mail on Polkadot ecosystem.
data.task3: Host 44 weekly Twitter Spaces on latest news.
data.task4: Create 44 weekly and thematic articles (DeFi on Polkadot, NFT, work on Polkadot 2.0â€¦).
data.task5: Creation of Polkabot. A bot that answers questions related to polkadot.
data.task6: Create 88 Linkedin posts to increase LinkedIn presence.
data.task7: Provide a calendly to 30min free call about Polkadot to onboard new users.

data.ptitle: Coinsider Media Campaign for Polkadot
data.summary: Kevin, founder of the Coinsider YouTube channel, proposes a specialized content campaign for Polkadot while emphasizing his channel's high-quality content and steady growth. He plans to create three educational videos covering Polkadot's decentralization, ecosystem projects, and upcoming upgrades.
data.task1: Create 3 high quality educational videos about specific topics on Polkadot.

data.ptitle: Polkadot RPC services - Dwellir Q3 2023 (retroactive)
data.summary: This proposal seeks retroactive funding for providing top-tier RPC services to the Polkadot ecosystem. With over 840 million RPC requests served during Q3, Dwellir operates a decentralized bare-metal infrastructure in Sweden and Tunisia, ensuring robustness, reliability, and low-latency communication. Led by a team with diverse expertise, Dwellir offers managed DevOps services, cost-effective infrastructure, intelligent auto-scaling, and global decentralization. They also address the lack of decentralized boot nodes by providing consistent support, strong network infrastructure, and geo-redundancy. Costs cover RPC services, boot nodes, monitoring, and administration, demonstrating Dwellir's value and commitment to the Polkadot community's needs.
data.task1: Dwellir provided decentralized RPC services for Polkadot communities in Q3 2023.

data.ptitle: DOTCAST - Pursuing quality improvement by spreading honest and true awareness
data.summary: This proposal aims to produce 16 Spanish podcast episodes over four months, covering updates, NFTs, gaming, and governance within the Polkadot and Kusama ecosystem. Led by Nachito and Roco, the goal of this initiative is to enhance its flagship podcast, expand its reach through marketing efforts, and create a dedicated website. With a focus on community engagement and education, DOTCAST plans to optimize its content based on real data and community feedback. The proposal outlines a comprehensive work strategy, including SEO/SEM and audience analysis, with commitments to transparency through regular reporting.
data.task1: Produce 16 podcast episodes videos for the Polkadot Spanish speaking community.

data.ptitle: Polkadot Ecosystem App Store - Dynamic App Pages & Project Reputation System - dotappstore.com
data.summary: The proposal aims to fund the development of Dotappstore's Dynamic App Pages and to enhance user experience within the Polkadot ecosystem. Key features include user authentication, upvoting, claiming, and reporting functionalities. The platform addresses the lack of a user-friendly interface, providing detailed guides that walkthrough users effectively. This initiative aims to establish itself as a trusted source for newcomers, stimulate the DOT economy, and potentially monetize through advertisements and paid project verification.
data.task1: User authentication flow for teams and users.
data.task2: Upvote feature to recommend apps by popularity.
data.task3: Claim feature for app pages to allow permissionless update of information by authenticated teams.
data.task4: Report feature to flag malicious projects.

data.ptitle: PolkaTube: Empowering the Spanish-Speaking Polkadot Ecosystem with RUST Programming, Substrate, and Marketing Content
data.summary: PolkaTube, led by Gerard and Domenico, proposes to produce educational and marketing videos over a 4-month period and to empower Spanish-speaking individuals to engage with Polkadot. Their content aims to attract, educate, and nurture new developers by covering technical topics like RUST programming language and Substrate. With a track record of organic growth and a commitment to quality, they seek to tap into the vast Spanish community, leveraging SEO strategies and persuasive content. The requested funding will support the creation of at least 15 educational videos and 5 SHORTs, providing valuable resources for Polkadot enthusiasts.
data.task1: Create minimum 15 high quality educational videos.
data.task2: Create at least 5 high quality educational SHORTs videos.

data.ptitle: Markedot: Marketplace and marketing with profits for the Polkadot and Kusama community
data.summary: This proposal seeks funding to manage the sale of Polkadot and Kusama branded merchandise through markedot.com, including items like t-shirts, caps, mugs, and stickers. Profits from sales will go directly to the treasury for community use. The aim is to tap into the growing e-commerce market and provide a unified platform for community members to purchase branded items. By leveraging online sales, the proposal aims to generate income for the DAO, support event organizers within the ecosystem, and promote brand awareness. The proposal outlines a detailed plan, including milestones for product design, marketing, and financial reporting over a 6-month period
data.task1: Design and incorporation of products with the Polkadot and Kusama Brand.
data.task2: Create the item collection for Polkadot and Kusama.
data.task3: Configuration of suppliers and shipping for the different regions where we will offer the sale of the items.
data.task4: Management of items and product orders with Polkadot and Kusama brands.
data.task5: Marketing of Polkadot and Kusama Items. Social Media: X, Instagram, Tiktok.
data.task6: Monthly report of income generated from the sale of items with the Polkadot and Kusama brands.

data.ptitle: Retroactive funding for 73 Chinese videos about Polkadot ecosystem
data.summary: MengLong requests retroactive funding for producing 73 educational videos about the Polkadot ecosystem and systematically introduced Polkadot and 13 parachain projects to the Chinese community. With plans for future content creation, translation work, and community engagement, MengLong aims to continue contributing to the development of the Polkadot Chinese community.
data.task1: Create 78 promotional and educational videos in Chinese about Polkadot ecosystem.

data.ptitle: AfterSide Crypto in Italian (Polkadot ecosystem video content in Italian) - 2 Videos
data.summary: AFTERSIDE CRYPTO, a blockchain channel in Italy with over 23,000 subscribers and 4.8+ million views, requests 1,500 DOT to create two educational videos about the Polkadot ecosystem in Italian. They have a strong and engaged community interested in Polkadot, evident from their previous videos on this topic. AFTERSIDE CRYPTO aims to contribute to Polkadot's visibility and understanding within the Italian-speaking stakeholders through their well-established platform.
data.task1: Create 2 educational videos about the Polkadot ecosystem in Italian.

data.ptitle: Polkadot Sanctuary: A Journey of Achievements and Innovations in Bali - Retroactive funding
data.summary: This proposal requests retroactive funding for showcasing a self-sustainable physical hub for the Polkadot ecosystem by establishing the Polkadot Sanctuary in Bali, Indonesia. The hub serves as a focal point for Polkadot enthusiasts, providing resources, support, and a collaborative environment for developers and entrepreneurs to build on the Polkadot network. The Bali Polkadot community has hosted nine BlockTalks, a bi-weekly meet-up that provides updates on Polkadot, and deep dives into blockchain and Web3 elements. They have persuaded the local government to develop on Substrate and utilize the Polkadot ecosystem, thereby creating job opportunities for substrate developers in the region
data.task1: Establishment of the Polkadot Sanctuary in Bali, providing a rent-free space as a central hub for Polkadot enthusiasts to access resources and foster collaboration.
data.task2: The Bali Polkadot community organized 9 bi-weekly BlockTalk meet-ups, engaging over 270 participants, to share updates on Polkadot, the crypto market, and Blockchain and Web3 concepts.
data.task3: The Polkadot community successfully hosted the Polkadot Decoded Viewing Party, drawing 70 attendees and showcasing the technological advancements and possibilities of Polkadot, igniting interest within the local blockchain community.
data.task4: Efforts to persuade the local government to adopt Substrate and utilize the Polkadot ecosystem have been fruitful, creating job opportunities for substrate developers in the region.
data.task5: Polkadot's sponsorship of the two-day Soulbound event during the Bali Blockchain Summit in August demonstrated significant benefits for Polkadot, as evidenced by the aftermovie and other success metrics.
data.task6: Five Polkadot Ambassador Candidates have been onboarded to expand Polkadot's network and drive adoption in Bali, with one candidate already becoming a fully-fledged ambassador.
data.task7: The Polkadot Sanctuary brand has been established across social media platforms, including Twitter and Telegram, with plans for website reconstruction by year-end.

data.ptitle: Crafting a Users & Developers Onboarding Funnel
data.summary: Juan Lago, also known as LV, is seeking funding for the development of DaBlock interface.The goal is to make Polkadot technology easier to understand for new users and boost visibility for Web3 projects and community members

data.task2: Undertake SEO-centric tasks, inclusive of content management and result tracking.
data.task4: Create between 15 and 30 how-to video guides.
data.task5: Release soft media content, ranging from interviews and live shows to vlogs and shorts adapting viral trends to Polkadot culture.
data.task6: Generate derivative content pieces for Twitter, with at least one for every main content piece.
data.task7: Diversify their reach by utilizing platforms like Youtube shorts, TikTok, LinkedIn, Reddit, and others.
data.task8: Enhance and continually expand the directory listings.
data.task9: Launch dedicated pages for individual projects and agents, offering a deeper dive into each entity's value proposition.
data.task10: Foster a community-centric approach by encouraging ecosystem enthusiasts to contribute to directory updates.

data.ptitle: Quality improvement of content for the Spanish Comunity by BRA_16-D
data.summary: The proposal seeks funding for the creation 52 pieces of Spanish content over 6-7 months, covering interviews, news, and tutorials. BRA_16-D aims to bridge the gap between retail users and ecosystem builders. The content will provide reliable information on Polkadot, Kusama, and the broader ecosystem, addressing the need for constant and informative content in Spanish.
data.task1: Create 21 videos related to News about Polkadot.
data.task2: Produce 8 interviews.
data.task4: Produce 17 how does this work videos.

data.ptitle: PROPOSAL FOR ADVANCING DECENTRALIZED FINANCE EDUCATION IN LATIN AMERICA WITH THE POLKADOT ECOSYSTEM
data.summary: This proposal aims to boost decentralized finance (DeFi) education in Latin America through three key phases: conducting a free pilot course on DeFi, launching a paid pilot course to test a sustainable academy model, and creating the first comprehensive DeFi book for the Polkadot ecosystem in Latin America. Led by MacZam, the project seeks to provide accessible education, evaluate a self-sustaining business model, increase Latin American representation in Polkadot, promote awareness of Polkadot, identify talents, and distribute educational materials across the region. Through these initiatives, the proposal wants to empower individuals and communities, enhance transparency, promote innovation, and democratize access to financial services in Latin America.
data.task1: Conducting an initial free pilot course aimed at Latin users interested in learning about decentralized finance.
data.task2: Launching a second pilot course to test the functionality of a new business model aimed at developing a DeFi academy.
data.task3: Editing the first comprehensive DeFi book dedicated to Polkadot for Latin America.

data.ptitle: AllInCrypto's Strategic Content and Community Engagement Proposal
data.summary: This proposal aims to boost Polkadot's global visibility through strategic content creation and community engagement. Leveraging various social media platforms including YouTube, Twitter, TikTok, and website, AllInCrypto, with a track record of over 51,000 YouTube subscribers, 8,000 website monthly views, and 8,000 Twitter followers, plans to publish educational articles, release regular videos, and share updates about Polkadot ecosystem. The budget allocation emphasizes content creation, marketing, community engagement, and operational expenses.
data.task1: Publish between 52-78 articles on their website, providing comprehensive insights and updates on Polkadot.
data.task2: Create 52 videos, including educational content, interviews, and updates related to the Polkadot ecosystem.
data.task3: Create between 100-200 posts on X, ensuring consistent engagement and information dissemination on the latest in Polkadot.

data.ptitle: TuPrimerBitcoin: Creation of quality content on Youtube to make the Spanish-speaking Polkadot ecosystem more visible
data.summary: This proposal aims to create high-quality Spanish-language content on Polkadot. With over 22,000 subscribers on YouTube, Gerard plans to produce full-length videos, shorts, and interviews over a 3-month period. The content will cover Polkadot updates, ecosystem evolution, on-chain data analysis, and encourage community involvement in governance. By reducing the requested funds by 75%, Gerard seeks to address community feedback and maximize the impact of Polkadot in the Spanish-speaking community.
data.task1: Create 12 videos about news and updates on Polkadot.
data.task2: Create 7 SHORTs videos.
data.task3: Create 1 interview with an industry leader.

data.ptitle: Proposal to Fund educational content for MAD CRIPTO MX YouTube Channel and twitter account
data.summary: The proposal aims to fund Mad Crypto MX's YouTube channel to continue producing high-quality Polkadot content in Spanish and English. With over 105,000 subscribers and 7.8 million views, the channel has been instrumental in educating viewers about Polkadot's ecosystem. The plan includes releasing two videos per week for six months, covering tutorials, ecosystem updates, and interviews. The content will cater to both new and experienced users, fostering a more informed and inclusive Polkadot community. Additionally, the proposal seeks to use metrics like the number of wallets and DOT delegated as key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the proposal's success in increasing network activity.
data.task1: Create 48 videos about Polkadot. Including deep-dive tutorials, regular updates and interviews.

data.ptitle: Polkadot System Parachain Collators - Tips Q4/2023
data.summary: This proposal aims to provide financial support to collators of Polkadot System Parachains for their operational expenses over a three-month period in late 2023. Collators, responsible for block production and maintaining network health, often receive minimal rewards, reducing their incentive to perform effectively. The proposal suggests compensating collators to ensure efficient performance and network stability. Funding will cover operational costs for collators across three system parachains and provide staking rewards to permission-less collators. The proposal outlines a detailed budget breakdown and payment conditions, emphasizing fair compensation and incentivizing active participation in the Polkadot ecosystem.
data.task1: Reward 20 collators of the Polkadot System Parachains for 3 month operational expenses. The tip amount varies from 71-607 $DOT.

data.ptitle: Maintenance for the substrate-api-client Jan-24 to Jun-24
data.summary: This proposal seeks funding to maintain the substrate-api-client from January to June 2024. The proposal emphasizes the library's role as a common good for the Polkadot ecosystem and offers a discounted hourly rate of 165 CHF for their services. Monthly progress reports will be shared on Polkassembly, and updates will be communicated on GitHub and the Polkadot Direction channel on Matrix.
data.task1: Provide maintance to the Substrate - api - client library which includes updates, user support, and small improvements.

data.ptitle: Bitskwela - Bringing Polkadot to the Thriving Philippine Web 3.0 Community
data.summary: Bitskwela aims to elevate Polkadot's presence in Philippines through education, community engagement, market research, and events while increasing awareness and understanding about Polkadot. This includes simplifying the whitepaper, conducting local market research, creating educational materials, producing short-form content, and organizing meetups. Leveraging Bitskwela's track record and partnerships, they seek funding to cover operational expenses and meet key performance indicators.
data.task1: Whitepaper Simplification (WPS) for Polkadot: Creation of a user-friendly summary of the Polkadot whitepaper translated into local languages.
data.task2: Local Market Research: Conducting a survey to gather insights on local user preferences and pain points in the Web3 space.
data.task3: Dedicated Short Guides: Producing quick 2-minute reads on different aspects of the Polkadot ecosystem.
data.task4: Short-Form Content and Community Awareness: Creating monthly localized short-form content to expand Polkadot's presence in the Philippines.
data.task5: Inclusion of Polkadot into Events and Talks: Integrating Polkadot branding into events and workshops hosted by Bitskwela.
data.task6: Polkadot Connect Philippines & Local Community: Organizing the first Polkadot Connect meetup and establishing a local community.
data.task7: Press Releases: Publishing monthly press releases on Polkadot ecosystem updates.
data.task8: Business Development for Polkadot Insider: Connecting local industry players with Polkadot Insider for further market expansion.

data.ptitle: OG Tracker
data.summary: This proposal aims to develop the OG Tracker tool. OG Tracker is a common good tool designed to enhance transparency and accountability within Polkadot by tracking deliverables and the ongoing progress of approved proposals in OpenGov. OG Tracker presents clearly its findings in a very user-friendly and easy to navigate interface. The project's duration last four months, divided into two milestones focusing on the development and optimization of the platform.
data.task1: Develop OG Tracker tool.
data.task2: Thorough Data collection.
data.task4: Clear overviews of each proposal's status.
data.task5: Real-time duration tracking.
data.task6: Deliverables demonstration.
data.task7: User-friendly and easy to navigate interface.

data.ptitle: Funding Development Costs for Dot Code School PoC - An Interactive Coding School to Build Meaningful Web3 Applications using the Polkadot SDK
data.summary: This proposal seeks funding to support the development of Dot Code School, an open learning platform for developers new to web3 and Polkadot. The platform aims to address the need for improved developer education by providing high-quality tutorials authored by experts, using real Rust projects as examples. These tutorials will be shaped into expressive stories with the assistance of writers and artists.
data.task1: Develop the PoC of Dot Code School.

data.ptitle: 2nd installment for the referendum #196 already approved (2/3)
data.summary: Cryptonitas proposes to produce 36 educational videos in Spanish for Polkadot and Kusama ecosystems over six months. Led by Cervera, aims to provide tutorials, news updates, live shows, shorts, and interviews to onboard newcomers and support community engagement. With a proven track record in content creation and community involvement, including event organization and support channels, Cryptonitas seeks to continue its educational efforts. Success metrics include tracking user actions and engagement, with payments divided into three installments.

data.task2: Create 4 videos about Polkadot & Kusama news.
data.task5: Create 2 interviews.

data.ptitle: A Chain of Blocks - ACOBJason - 6 Months Continual Polkadot EcoSystem News & Explanations
data.summary: This proposal by AChainofBlocks outlines a comprehensive plan to create educational content about the Polkadot ecosystem. It includes producing three-minute explanatory videos, short vertical clips, space sessions, and in-depth threads. The aim is to simplify complex concepts for mainstream audiences and increase community engagement across various social media platforms like YouTube, X, TikTok, and Instagram. With a proven track record of well-received content, AChainofBlocks seeks funding to continue producing high-quality videos and expanding their reach within the Polkadot community.

data.ptitle: Chopsticks Web for dry run governance proposals and more
data.summary: This proposal introduces Chopsticks Web, a tool developed to scrutinize OpenGov proposals within the Polkadot ecosystem. It addresses the issue of failed proposals and the need for repeated resubmission, aiming to save time and mitigate potential security risks. The tool supports various types of proposals across relaychain and parachains.
data.task1: Development of Chopsticks Web.
data.task2: Maintenance.

data.ptitle: Maintenance & Support Substrate Python API (Oct-Dec 2023)
data.summary: This proposal seeks retroactive funding for the Polkascan Foundation's maintenance and support of the Substrate Python API from October to December 2023. The foundation has focused on developing version 2 of the libraries, addressing issues with ink! contract versioning, and providing technical support. With significant dependencies on the Python API, including 297 GitHub repositories and 23 Python packages, the foundation's efforts are crucial for Python developers interacting with Polkadot, Kusama, and other Substrate-based chains. The proposal outlines 127 hours of work spent during the period and requests funding to continue supporting and enhancing the Substrate Python API.
data.task1: Developed version 2 of the Substrate Python API and py-scale-codec libraries.
data.task2: Addressed issues with ink! contract versioning in the latest v1.7.5 release.
data.task3: Released new alpha versions with MetadataV15 support.
data.task4: Provided technical support on GitHub and in #polkascan:matrix.org and substrate.stackexchange.com channels.

data.ptitle: ink! + Ethereum RPC = ethink!. Proposal-01: PoC and Prototype
data.summary: The proposal outlines the development of ethink!, aiming to enhance Polkadot's smart contract ecosystem by seamlessly integrating ink! smart contracts with Ethereum's user-friendly tools like MetaMask. The Proof of Concept (PoC) has been successfully completed, demonstrating the ability to interact with ink! contracts via MetaMask. The next stage, the Early Prototype, aims to refine the project for practical use, focusing on compatibility with ERC20 tokens and improving Ethereum RPC methods. The project aims to attract Ethereum users to Polkadot without compromising on user experience, potentially opening up new possibilities for decentralized application development in the ecosystem.
data.task1: Template node and runtime implementations.
data.task2: Basic Ethereum RPC implementations with minimum required working methods.
data.task3: Auxiliary crates porting for Ethereum types and transactions handling.
data.task4: Ethereum chain data emulators: block, header, transaction receipt.
data.task5: Customize ink! & cargo-contract to support Ethereum Accounts and signing.
data.task6: Ethereum signatures verification.
data.task7: Ethereum transaction decoding and translation into an extrinsic.
data.task8: Pallet-polkamask: basic working version for transaction routing.
data.task9: Basic dApp for testing and demo (.sol + .ink contracts + frontend).
data.task11: Make ethink! work with ERC20 example.
data.task12: Polish Ethereum RPC methods implemented at the previous stage.
data.task13: Implement more Ethereum RPC methods from the by now mocked set.
data.task14: Add various tests, from unit to integration ones.
data.task15: Overall code refactoring and better crates organization.
data.task16: Documentation both in rustdoc and in the form of a Rust book.

data.ptitle: Polkadot in Finance: A Strategic Partnership Development Proposal
data.summary: The Polkadot-Financial Institution Partnership Initiative proposed by Ben Sheppard of Silta Finance aims to bridge the Polkadot ecosystem with the financial sector over a 6-month period. Leveraging Sheppard's expertise in structured finance and blockchain, the initiative seeks to forge strategic partnerships and develop Proof of Concepts (PoCs) with financial institutions. The plan involves creating a compelling value proposition for Polkadot, identifying financial challenges that blockchain can address, and mapping out innovative solutions. By doing so, it aims to enhance Polkadot's visibility in the financial industry, demonstrate its practical utility, and attract further interest and investment.
data.task1: Attract financial institutions to the Polkadot ecosystem.

data.ptitle: PolkaWarriors - Cultivate a robust & collaborative community of Polkadot in Vietnam
data.summary: The PolkaWarriors proposal aims to strengthen the Polkadot ecosystem's ties with the Vietnamese community over a 6-month period. Founded by DOT ecosystem veterans Sang and Tony, PolkaWarriors seeks to grow a robust community of Polkadot enthusiasts in Vietnam, from beginners to advanced users. Their strategy is outlined through educational materials, news updates, content videos, community meetups, workshops, and partnerships.

data.task2: Short Tutorial & Interview Videos: Produce 20 tutorial and interview videos on various aspects of the Polkadot ecosystem.
data.task3: AMA & Live Broadcast: Host 20 AMAs and live panels with projects within the Polkadot ecosystem.
data.task4: Workshops & Local Meetups: Organize 2 workshops for students and 2 community meetups in Ho Chi Minh City and Hue.
data.task5: Promotion of Substrate Course: Collaborate with the Lowlevelers team to promote a Substrate course.
data.task6: Business Development: Generate leads and connect potential partners and developers in Vietnam to the Polkadot ecosystem.

data.ptitle: Treasury Proposal: Marketing and media proposal for Polkadot in China
data.summary: Jinse Finance, a leading blockchain and Web3 information platform in China, proposes a year-long initiative to enhance Polkadot's presence in the Chinese market. This proposal includes media exposure, community promotion, and support for up to five top-rated Polkadot ecosystem projects. By leveraging Jinse Finance's extensive reach, including over 20 million users and significant daily traffic, the plan aims to attract more users and developers to Polkadot. The strategy encompasses disseminating important Polkadot updates, organizing online and offline events and promote outstanding projects within the ecosystem. This comprehensive package is designed to overcome challenges such as stiff competition, lack of promotional channels, and the need for localized strategies.

data.task2: Organize online and offline events.
data.task3: Promote outstanding projects in Polkadot ecosystem.

data.ptitle: KILT Decentralized Identity Provider (DIP) - Polkadot Medium Spender Proposal
data.summary: The proposal aims to develop the KILT Decentralized Identity Provider (DIP), offering an OpenID-like authentication flow for Web3. It enables cross-chain identity establishment by using on-chain and off-chain mechanisms. Led by BOTLabs GmbH, seeks to reduce centralization in identity management while providing users control over their data. Key components include pallets for identity providers and relying parties, along with support crates for chain runtimes. The proposal outlines milestones for development, testing, and deployment, highlighting the need for ongoing maintenance and future enhancements
data.task1: Develop the KILT Decentralized Identity Provider (DIP) protocol.
data.task2: Deploy provider and relying party components on testnets and production chains.
data.task3: Test, integrate, and fix any issues that arise during deployment.
data.task4: Maintain and update the protocol to ensure compatibility with the latest Polkadot versions.
data.task5: Explore and implement future improvements, such as support for verifiable credentials and trustless parachain-to-parachain messaging solutions.

data.ptitle: Saturn Gateway - A Multichain Multisig Application for the Polkadot Ecosystem
data.summary: The InvArch Association proposes the development of Saturn Gateway. It offers a seamless interface for managing multichain multisig accounts and addressing the fragmented experience across parachains. Key features include account creation, asset management, and cross-chain transaction bundling. It benefits parachains, institutions, and users by providing secure, decentralized asset custody. Milestones cover UI designs, wallet integrations, and DOT fee token support. The proposal aligns with Polkadot's vision of a multichain future, enhancing user experience while boosting the DOT token's utility.
data.task1: Create a user interface design and functional requirements for an account creation page and an asset dashboard that includes supported networks. Integrate Wallet Connect.
data.task2: Develop an XCM bundled transaction builder and widgets, along with a transactions and proposals dashboard, as well as an ownership dashboard.
data.task3: Integrate ecosystem wallet support for Talisman, Nova Wallet, SubWallet, and Enkrypt.
data.task4: Implement support for DOT fee tokens and provide guides and resources for users.

data.ptitle: Subsquare and dotreasury new features development plan including governance statistics, dotreasury dark mode, etc
data.summary: The proposal outlines developments for Subsquare and Dotreasury, including retroactive work and new features. Subsquare enhancements involve Collectives support, governance statistics, and UI improvements. Dotreasury plans for a dark mode, spend statistics, and better filtering options. With a comprehensive budget estimate, the proposal aims to enhance user experience and functionality across both platforms within the Polkadot ecosystem.
data.task1: Polkadot alliance support, dotreasury OpenGov spent pie chart, subsquare delivered enhancement features.
data.task2: Subsquare new features:Governance statistics, user governance participation view and management, new design and other enhancements.
data.task3: Dotreasury new features: dark mode, treasury spend statisc by periods.

data.ptitle: Encode Club Tranches 2 and 3
data.summary: This proposal outlines a funding request for two completed events: an online hackathon and the Decoded hackathon. The request covers unpaid hacker prizes and seeks support for running future hackathons, including an in-person event at Decoded happening earlier than planned.
data.task1: Organizing and funding the first online hackathon prizes.
data.task2: Planning and funding the second online hackathon.
data.task3: Arranging and financing an in-person hackathon at Decoded.

data.ptitle: Subsquid - Public data indexing Infrastructure for Polkadot and Kusama (Q1 2023)
data.summary: The proposal from Subsquid Lab Official outlines ongoing development and maintenance costs for public Subsquid Archives and the Giant Squid API. It covers the provision of archives, a crucial component of Polkadot and Kusama data infrastructure, offering access to on-chain data for various parachains. Additionally, the Giant Squid API provides GraphQL endpoints for exploring relay and parachain statistics, supporting a wide range of projects. The proposal seeks funding for the continued operation and expansion of these services. Overall, it aims to enhance accessibility and usability of on-chain data for developers and users within the Polkadot and Kusama ecosystems.
data.task1: Ongoing development and maintenance of public Subsquid Archives API.
data.task2: Ongoing development and maintenance of public Giant Squid API.

data.ptitle: Subscan | Infrastructure Costs of Subscan for Polkadot & Westend & Rococo & Statemint & Rockmine Networks (from July to December 2022)
data.summary: This proposal seeks reimbursement from the Polkadot treasury to cover Subscan's operation and maintenance costs from July to December 2022. Subscan plays a vital role as a block explorer and analytics tool for the Polkadot network. The reimbursement will cover expenses including server infrastructure, security measures, and personnel costs. Server infrastructure costs are estimated to support the network's smooth operation. Security measures ensure user data safety, while personnel costs reflect the dedicated team needed to maintain Subscan's functionality. This support ensures Subscan's continuous operation and contributes to the growth and development of the Polkadot network.
data.task1: Reimbursing operation and maintenance costs for Subscan.
data.task2: Supporting server infrastructure for smooth operation.
data.task3: Ensuring high-level security measures for user data safety.
data.task4: Providing personnel for dedicated maintenance and support.

data.ptitle: ink! design security review by OpenZeppelin
data.summary: The proposal seeks funding for OpenZeppelin's security review of Polkadot's ink! smart contract language and Substrate's smart contracts pallet. The review, conducted between January 23rd and February 17th, identified and addressed security vulnerabilities, ensuring the safety of users. Ink! serves as a crucial component for Polkadot parachains, attracting developers and enabling easy migration to parachain runtimes. OpenZeppelin, a trusted security firm, collaborated closely with Parity Technologies, the ink! team, and other contributors throughout the process. The proposal outlines milestone deliverables and payment conditions, emphasizing transparency and accountability.
data.task1: Substrate + ink! Preparation: Deep dive into ecosystem, understand language functionality, and create system overview report.
data.task2: Security Review: Analyze ink! and Substrate security, validate claims, identify threats, categorize issues, and deliver assessment report.
data.task3: Fix Review: Collaborate on issue resolution, validate fixes, and deliver finalized security analysis report.

data.ptitle: Milestone 2: Polkadot Hackathon Global Series 2023: Europe Edition
data.summary: The proposal outlines AngelHack's Polkadot Global Series: Europe Edition, aiming to foster engagement within the Web3 community. It recaps the virtual hackathon and in-person dotSocial event, detailing participant metrics, challenge tracks, and budget breakdown. Notable outcomes include 923 participants, 495 formed teams, and diverse track winners. Insights reveal strong interest in blockchain, desire for better mentorship, and clearer communication. Future improvements include enhanced team formation support, clearer guidelines, and expanded workshop offerings. Despite falling short of some registration targets, the event successfully engaged a diverse group and provided valuable learnings for future hackathons. AngelHack seeks funding for the event's execution, emphasizing its impact on developer outreach and project adoption within the Polkadot ecosystem.
data.task1: Launch and Management of Polkadot Hackathon Global Series: Europe Edition.

Their strategy includes regular content creation, event organization, community engagement, and infrastructure support. Initiatives like weekly news updates, governance news, and Polkadot meetups are prioritized, alongside Twitter spaces, AMAs and Zealy quests. The team seeks funding for 12 months to support their activities and commits to provide regular reports on their progress.

It aims to promote Substrate and Polkadot ecosystem growth by attracting developers and converting course learners into builders. Previous hackathons in 2021 and 2022 have been successful, and this event is scheduled for July 2023. Specific metrics include developer participation and project diversity. The execution plan includes registration, coding, workshops, and a demo day. Costs encompass venue, materials, travel, staff compensation, and an afterparty. The proposal emphasizes community building, technical education, and ecosystem expansion, aligning with Parity Asia's Substrate initiatives.
data.task1: Organize and execute the Hackathon in Shangai,China.

data.ptitle: Polkadot Relayers Incubator 2023
data.summary: The Polkadot Relayers program, initiated in 2022, aims to foster dApp development on Polkadot parachains. In 2023, it focuses on nurturing 14 committed teams across Europe, Asia, North America, and Latin America. The program seeks to provide mentorship, investment, and ecosystem support, collaborating closely with 7 dedicated parachain teams. Eligible teams include past Polkadot Hackathon finalists, other Web3 participants, and those building or intending to build on participating parachains. Success metrics include the number of incubated teams, Showcase Day attendee demographics, and participant testimonials. The program timeline span is 9 weeks.

data.task2: Nurture 14 committed teams looking to build on Polkadot, providing them with mentorship and community support from the 7 dedicated parachains, AngelHack, and Parity Technologies.

data.task5: Rally support from Web3 investors to have a larger involvement in the program, with potential further collaboration with the Polkadot ecosystem.

The upcoming quarter focuses on maintenance, refining discovery processes, refactoring syncing code, and implementing JSON-RPC for full node. Totaling 240 hours, the budget emphasizes code quality over strict milestone completion.

data.ptitle: OnFinality High Performance Public Infrastructure
data.summary: OnFinality is a platform that provides infrastructure services for the Polkadot/Substrate community. They have been providing free public API services for Polkadot, Statemint, Westend, Collectives, and Encointer to help grow the ecosystem, scale existing projects, and assist with testing. They have made improvements to their Ultimate API service to focus on performance/reliability, providing more value, and cost optimization. They have launched Trace API, geographical insights, clarified their IP address handling, added support for new networks, and made improvements to their health metric collection tools. They have served a total of 3.4 billion responses and accumulated over 44,000 GB of data egress between April and June 2023. They have a 99.99% reliability and run clusters in 5 different regions and across 3 different cloud providers
data.task1: Maintain high-performance infrastructure for multiple blockchain networks.
data.task2: Ensure system reliability with minimal downtime.

data.task5: Expand network support to include new blockchain ecosystems.
data.task6: Scale team and systems to accommodate increasing demand.
data.task7: Continue commitment to providing free API access for developers.

data.ptitle: Building a better understanding of blockchain across mainstream global media
data.summary: Thomson Reuters Foundation (TRF) proposes a strategic partnership with Every.org to educate non-crypto individuals and journalists about Web3 and blockchain technologies. This partnership aims to counteract simplified and inaccurate media narratives by developing a pilot training program. TRF plans to conduct extensive media mapping and discourse analysis, followed by a tailored training course for journalists in Europe. The course will cover blockchain basics, debunk misconceptions, and connect journalists with experts. Marketing efforts will leverage LinkedIn and Twitter to reach the target audience. The pilot program includes online courses, mentoring, and in-person workshops, emphasizing hands-on learning and peer collaboration.

data.ptitle: Moderation Team Bounty
data.summary: This proposal seeks funding to sustain and enhance the Polkadot Moderation Team, originally formed as volunteers. The team ensures the safety and integrity of official Polkadot channel, handling tasks like monitoring, dispute resolution, and user support while emphasizing the essential role of moderators in community growth. The proposal includes a detailed breakdown of team roles, evaluation processes, success criteria, and budget distribution, addressing concerns about the team's size and tracking moderator activities. The request covers a six-month period and is contingent on successful peer assessments and fulfilling roles effectively.

data.ptitle: Polkadot Nominator Insight Hub. Spreading the Best Nominator Strategies through TOP Nomination Leaderboards
data.summary: The proposal focuses on enhancing Polkadot's Nominated Proof-of-Stake (NPOS) system by addressing suboptimal nominator behavior through benchmarking and dashboards. Nominators play a crucial role in Polkadot's security but risk disincentivization due to inefficient actions. To mitigate this, the proposal suggests implementing benchmarking based on efficient nominator activities, showcased through user-friendly dashboards. These dashboards offer insights into nominator rewards, validator payouts, and nomination pool trends, empowering stakeholders with data-driven strategies. The team, experienced in blockchain research, plans to deliver desktop web apps following Similarweb's user-friendly style, fostering community collaboration and promoting system decentralization

data.ptitle: SubQuery <> Nova Wallet Common API: Maintenance Cost For Q1-Q2 2023
data.summary: This proposal seeks funding to sustain the SubQuery Common API infrastructure, crucial for applications like Nova Wallet in Q1-Q2 2023. The API provides pre-indexed data for 74 Substrate-based networks, enabling access to essential information like operation history, staking analytics, and OpenGov queries. The partnership between SubQuery and Nova Wallet has greatly enhanced the Polkadot ecosystem, offering seamless data access. Future plans include expanding data accessibility, decentralizing the API, and proposing funding requests directly to the Polkadot community for sustained growth.

data.ptitle: Polkawatch, Decentralization Analytics, Continued Operation and Development

Supported by the Web3 Foundation and funded by Polkadot and Kusama treasuries, Polkawatch evaluates decentralization based on validation activities across regions, computing networks, and node operators. It utilizes reward events and networking data to analyze validation operations by geography and operator. Polkawatch serves as a community resource, providing insights to nominators and validators, with a focus on promoting decentralization awareness.

data.ptitle: Smoldot development financing Q4/2023
data.summary: Smoldot is a lightweight client software for connecting to the Polkadot blockchain's peer-to-peer network. Its purpose is to eliminate the need for trusted servers, enhancing security and reducing maintenance costs. Developed solely by Pierre Krieger, a Polkadot technical fellowship member, Smoldot aims to conform to the Polkadot protocol, provide a good user experience, improve infrastructure, and potentially build a new full node implementation. Quarterly milestones include general maintenance, periodic networking key rotation, implementing new JSON-RPC APIs for better network visualization, and enabling warp syncing for the full node. Pierre Krieger's track record in open-source projects and expertise in Polkadot development underscore Smoldot's high reliability.
data.task1: General maintenance of the project.
data.task2: Periodically rotate the networking key.

data.ptitle: NFT XCM
data.summary: This proposal aims to introduce NFT interoperability within the Polkadot ecosystem, addressing the current limitation of only fungible asset transfers. It outlines a comprehensive approach to enable the seamless transfer of NFTs across parachains, enhancing Polkadot's value proposition of interoperability. The proposal involves creating an XCM Asset Transfer Architecture to handle the unique characteristics of NFTs, addressing challenges such as collection registration, NFT addressing, and fee estimations. It also reviews existing UI implementations across wallets and bridges, proposing API approaches and integration tools for easier adoption. The estimated completion is by the end of 2024, with a collaborative effort from various stakeholders in the ecosystem.

data.ptitle: Genesis DAO Ecosystem Integration
data.summary: The proposal focuses on developing Stylograph, a framework designed to enhance substrate-based chains in the Polkadot ecosystem by adding plugin-like functionality. The first implementation will be Genesis DAO, which will use Stylograph to provide hookpoint functionality that extends its basic operations through configurable ink! contracts. The proposal outlines the development of various DAO components, including voting mechanisms, vesting wallets, and a plugin and extension store, to enable flexible, scalable DAO tooling. The goal is to make Genesis DAO a system parachain that uses DOT for fees, promoting a robust, adaptable ecosystem.

data.ptitle: Increase MaxMemoryPages to 512MB
data.summary: This proposal suggests increasing the memory limit for PVF (Parachain Validator Function) execution from 128MB to 512MB. The aim is to ensure that parachain blocks can be executed by validators without memory limitations, as they may need to load state proofs into memory.

data.ptitle: Setting the relay chain's safeXcmVersion to v3
data.summary: This proposal aims to resolve a recent XCM issue that caused conflicts in transactions by aligning the relay chain's safeXcmVersion to v3. This adjustment ensures that XCMs are sent in the v3 format by default, preventing issues between the relay chain and parachains

data.ptitle: Fix HostConfiguration

data.ptitle: Unbrick Nodle

data.ptitle: Moonbeam: Swap Leases with Parachain 3342
data.summary: Moonbeamâ€™s current lease period on the Polkadot network will expire in October 2023. In June 2023, the Moonbeam Foundation successfully secured a new parachain slot on Polkadot covering lease periods 13 through 20.This proposal is a necessary step to extending Moonbeamâ€™s Polkadot lease period through June 2025 by executing a swap of lease periods.

data.ptitle: Proposal for USDC Sufficiency on Polkadot Asset Hub
data.summary: Circle, the issuer of USDC, a fully reserved stablecoin backed by cash, seeks Polkadot Relay Chain governance approval to make USDC sufficient on Polkadot. This would enable USDC to be used for transaction fees and held in accounts without requiring DOT. The proposal aims to simplify user experience, attract mainstream users, and expand USDC liquidity within the Polkadot ecosystem.

data.ptitle: Polkadot Treasury USDT Acquisition
data.summary: The Polkadot Technical Fellowship is crucial for the network's development but lacks a stable financial model for salary distribution. This proposal suggests using DCA orders to exchange DOT for USDT through the HydraDX Omnipool, creating a predictable daily conversion to support the Fellowship's salaries. This complex process will follow the Root track for execution.

data.ptitle: DeFi Infrastructure & Tooling Bounty
data.summary: This proposal addresses two key gaps in Polkadot's DeFi ecosystem: the lack of unified infrastructure and tooling. The infrastructure challenge stems from difficulties in convincing external infrastructure providers to integrate with Polkadot due to low liquidity and perceived complexity. On the tooling side, teams struggle with securing funding through referendums and lack of incentives for teams to tackle ecosystem-wide problems. The proposed solution involves establishing a curator set to provide guidelines and oversee the development of key infrastructure and tooling with retroactive funding from the treasury upon successful delivery.

data.ptitle: Redot #1: Polkadot Restaking and Enabling Polkadot DA Capabilities
data.summary: The proposal aims to enhance Polkadot's interoperability and security while enabling integration with Ethereum and Bitcoin ecosystems. It supports data availability and various networks, requiring validators to run only a light client. Redot aims to match Polkadot's security level, providing secure data synchronization and enabling Bitcoin L2 support for smart contracts. The proposal is divided into three milestones, with the first already in progress

data.ptitle: Veles project proposal - Carbon credits pallet
data.summary: This aims to create transparent and user-friendly carbon credit trading platforms within Polkadot by providing a framework for integrating carbon credit functionalities into various applications, fostering the carbon credit market on Web3 platforms..
data.task1: Phase 1: Initial definition.
data.task2: Phase 2: Core Development.

data.ptitle: Meetups Bounty [#43]
data.summary: The purpose of this bounty is to quickly fund meetups for small amounts. The idea is quick turnaround when the amount required is small. The total limit per meetup for this bounty is $1000.

data.ptitle: Project Glove: Introducing Capital Efficiency and Pseudo-Anonymity on top of OpenGov
data.summary: This proposal aims to boost participation and decentralize voting power in OpenGov, without changing Polkadot's core network. By enabling more active and anonymous participation for DOT holders, it seeks to create a more inclusive and dynamic governance environment, improving engagement in Polkadot's ecosystem. The deliverables will be open source, under an AGPL license, to encourage adoption and ensure long-term sustainability through increased governance participation and network transactions.
data.task1: Develop an opt-in protocol for enhancing capital efficiency and pseudo-anonymity in Polkadot's OpenGov voting system.

data.ptitle: Retroactive Funding for Mimir - A Powerful Multisig Management Application For Polkadot Ecosystem
data.summary: This proposal aims to transform the Polkadot ecosystem with an enterprise-grade multisig solution, tackling challenges in managing non-EOA wallets. It utilizes Substrate's features for Static, Flexible, and Nested Multisig accounts, enhancing operational efficiency and security for entities handling significant funds.Mimir's deployment on the Rococo testnet and partnership with Subsquare highlight its potential to boost efficiency and security in the Polkadot ecosystem
data.task1: Mimir Supports Multisig Accounts With Flexible Member and Threshold.
data.task2: Mimir Supports Nested Multisig Accounts at Any Level.
data.task3: Mimir Integrates with Third-Party Applications, Supporting Multisig Operations.

data.ptitle: Polkadot-API: development financing
data.summary: Polkadot-API aims to improve the development experience for decentralized applications (dApps) in the Polkadot ecosystem. It enhances PolkadotJS with a focus on light-client optimization and modular, composable libraries. The proposal covers a two-month period, with future funding dependent on project progress.
data.task1: General maintenance of the Project.
data.task2: Leverage the new Tx Broadcast API.

data.task6: Add offline API.

data.ptitle: Polkadot Moderation Team Bounty Top-up
data.summary: The Polkadot Moderation Team Bounty Top-Up proposal seeks to extend support to the Polkadot Moderation Team, rewarding their continuous efforts in safeguarding community integrity and providing assistance. The team, composed of 13 members, monitors various official channels, including Discord, Reddit, and Twitter, ensuring adherence to community guidelines and resolving disputes.

data.ptitle: Funding Development Costs for Expanding Dot Code School â€” Interactive Coding School â€” Bridging the Gap Between Online Learning and Real-World Web3 Development with Local Coding Environments
data.summary: The proposal aims to improve Dot Code School by adding local coding environments and help new Polkadot SDK developers by simulating real-world development. It suggests using a custom Git server with chapter-specific tests to connect theory with practice. Led by Batman, this initiative makes learning easier through UI design, feedback, and accountability features.

data.ptitle: 2024 Polkadot Decoded China (Hong Kong) July 27-28
data.summary: The 2024 Polkadot Decoded Asia event, proposed by Aitijia'er, aims to complement the flagship Decoded conference with a regional focus in Asia. It addresses logistical challenges and language barriers faced by the Asian Polkadot community. Scheduled two weeks after the main event in Brussels, Decoded Asia will feature presentations, panels, workshops, and exhibitions tailored to the Asian market, with content delivered in Chinese and English.
data.task1: Organize Polkadot Decoded in Hong Kong.

data.ptitle: LiteSend - remittance service secured by Polkadot
data.summary: Electrocoin introduces LiteSend, a blockchain-based remittance platform for secure and efficient cross-border money transfers. LiteSend simplifies remittance through a user-friendly website, reducing fees and enhancing security. Using blockchain technology, LiteSend bypasses traditional banking delays and regulatory barriers, offering faster and cheaper transactions.

data.task2: Integrate AssetHubâ€™s stablecoin transactions in LiteSendâ€™s platform.

data.ptitle: Implementing a Polkadot-native system parachain for data storage: Phase 1/3
data.summary: This proposal aims to add native storage to Polkadot, exclusively using DOT as the native token. This storage solution would allow anyone in the ecosystem to store and retrieve data through XCM. The proposal emphasizes that this is a network-owned solution, a system parachain, not a private endeavor. Everything would be open source and open license, with DOT as the exclusive fee payment token, ensuring decentralization and community involvement in maintaining and improving the system.
data.task1: Research.
data.task2: Documentation.

data.ptitle: Swissborg Proposal - A One Month Polkadot Awareness Campaign
data.summary: The proposal outlines a one-month awareness campaign for Polkadot led by Swissborg. The campaign targets Swissborg's 750k user base to increase awareness and the holder base for Polkadot.

data.ptitle: Treasury Proposal: Futarchy, a New Signal Generating Tech for Polkadot Governance
data.summary: The Zeitgeist proposal suggests integrating combinatorial prediction markets into Polkadot's governance to improve decision-making with data-driven insights. This approach aims to encourage active participation, validate proposals, and enhance clarity in governance.

data.summary: This proposal aims to educate and engage developers in the Polkadot ecosystem through a six-month campaign. EasyA plans to educate 40,000 developers via its app and host two in-person hackathons at Harvard University and in London. The initiative seeks to attract new talent, increase awareness, and facilitate the development of innovative projects on Polkadot by providing educational content, fostering developer engagement, and promoting Polkadot's unique features.
data.task1: Execute the #180DaysOfPolkadot campaign, including conducting in-depth Polkadot in-app challenges, organizing two landmark in-person Polkadot hackathons, creating Polkadot-specific content for the EasyA app, integrating technical implementations within the app, and hosting workshops and developer interviews.

data.ptitle: The Decentralized Future of Business Development for Polkadot
data.summary: This proposal seeks funding to enhance Polkadot's business development by sourcing and placing five experienced web3 business development executives through Missing Link. The initiative aims to attract top talent, promote broader outreach for partnerships and enterprise adoption, and improve the effectiveness of Polkadot's BD strategies. Missing Link plans to conduct market mapping, sourcing, screening, and selection, followed by decentralized futures application and acceptance by the Web3 Foundation.
data.task1: Cover the service of sourcing, interviewing, strategizing, and placing 5 experienced, world-class web3 business development executives to generate successful partnerships and key cross-ecosystem products to adopt Polkadot.

data.ptitle: Polkadot sponsorship for LIFT Learning - A Fenasbac + Central Bank of Brazil initiative
data.summary: The proposal seeks sponsorship for Polkadot's inclusion in the LIFT Learning program by Fenasbac, affiliated with the Central Bank of Brazil. It aims to develop a proof of concept using the Polkadot SDK for potential integration with the Brazilian Central Bank's digital currency (CBDC). The partnership leverages the LIFT Learning platform to engage the University of Rio de Janeiro and COPPETEC in creating innovative solutions for the National Financial System.
data.task1: Develop interoperable bridging solutions that can be used by the Central Bank in Brazil.

data.ptitle: Bounty proposal: Business Development Polkadot in Spain & Andorra
data.summary: This proposal outlines the creation of a business development incentive program for Polkadot in Spain and Andorra, aiming to attract potential clients and integrate them into the Polkadot ecosystem. Led by a diverse team with extensive experience in various sectors, the initiative seeks to convert identified prospects into active users or developers within the Polkadot network.

data.ptitle: Bounty Proposal: [Spanish content and event production bounty]
data.summary: The proposal outlines the second version of the Spanish content and event production bounty for the Polkadot & Kusama ecosystems. It aims to reward content creators and organizers for their contributions in Spanish, enhancing community engagement and knowledge dissemination.

data.ptitle: POLKADOT <> KUSAMA BRIDGE SECURITY BOUNTY
data.summary: This proposal seeks funding for a Bug Bounty Program to enhance the security of the Polkadot/Kusama Bridges. With the goal of ensuring a secure mechanism for asset exchange between different chains, the Bug Bounty Program aims to identify and address potential security breaches before widespread adoption. Overall, the Bug Bounty Program aims to engage the community in identifying and mitigating security vulnerabilities to support the decentralization and interoperability goals of Polkadot and Kusama.

data.ptitle: OpenGov Discord Voting Bot Development
data.summary: Jordan (N4DRO) from ChaosDAO is requesting funding from the Polkadot treasury to focus full-time on improving the OpenGov Community Voting Discord Bot. The proposal includes funding for past work, a support contract for future development, and new features like integration with Polkassembly and a Solo Mode. The bot has been successful in enhancing on-chain governance and has been used by communities like ChaosDAO and KusDAO.

data.task2: Expansion through additional feature development.

The proposal includes retroactive funding for feature development, UX enhancement, QA testing, and audit fixes. Talisman aims to support diverse hardware wallets, improve account management, enhance worldwide usability, and provide clearer transaction comprehension.

The bounty is designed to support marketing for Polkadot without specific rules or restrictions on the type of marketing supported. The focus is on identifying the best opportunities for marketing as they arise, prioritizing quality results and effectiveness over complicated and detailed proposals.

data.ptitle: Transfer the Lease of Bifrost Parachain 3356 to Bifrost Parachain 2030 to avoid downtime
data.summary: Bifrost secured lease 16-23 via crowdloan paraid 3356, causing a block production interruption for para 2030. To address this, a lease swap is proposed. The solution involves clearing lease 16-23 for para 3356 and adding it to para 2030 via the Lease Admin governance track. Detailed steps include clearing leases and re-reserving DOTs. Governance logic ensures no extra resource consumption. Potential risks include uncertainty regarding crowdloan unlocking but are deemed manageable pending Parity developers' confirmation.

data.summary: This referendum is suggesting a cleanup of several bounties on Polkadot as part of our ongoing housekeeping efforts to ensure a well-maintained and efficient chain environment.

data.ptitle: Setting setOnDemandQueueMaxSize to 500
data.summary: This proposal is adjusting Polkadot's setOnDemandMaxQueueSize to 500, akin to Kusama, to address slow block import times caused by a surplus of on-demand cores processing large batch calls from parachains, as observed on Rococo, offering a temporary fix until a permanent solution is implemented.

data.ptitle: Pinkdrop: Powering User Engagement and Ecosystem Growth
data.summary: Pinkdrop, a popular casual browser game in the Polkadot ecosystem, seeks funding to expand its features with a mobile app and on-chain tournaments. Developed by the Great Escape team, Pinkdrop merges Parachain balls strategically to accumulate points. The proposal aims to enhance user engagement and attract new users to Polkadot by making the game more accessible and exciting.

data.task2: Milestone 2: Mobile Application Development.

data.ptitle: Universal Hybrid Substrate Faucet
data.summary: The proposal outlines the creation of a one-stop, hybrid testnet faucet for the Polkadot ecosystem, supporting all substrate chains and EVMs on those chains. It introduces two key modes: a network switcher mode for individual disbursements and a network selector mode for bulk disbursements across multiple chains. This initiative aims to streamline cross-chain testing, making it more efficient and user-friendly.
data.task1: Faucet with 2 modes: Network switcher mode & Network selector mode.
data.task2: EVM Support.

data.ptitle: Codigo Brazuca + Polkadot Brazil - Tech Academy - from Basic to Advanced - 8 Months Track
data.summary: The proposal from CÃ³digo Brazuca and Polkadot Brazil aims to establish an 8 to 10-month Tech Academy focused on Polkadot technology, with the goal of expanding and adopting the Polkadot ecosystem in Brazil. The academy plans to offer a high-quality educational curriculum covering basic to advanced concepts to train 100 developers, using both online and in-person modalities.
data.task1: Establish a Tech Academy focused on Polkadot technology, targeting the expansion and adoption of the Polkadot ecosystem in Brazil.

data.ptitle: Funding for Decentralized Social Media Editorial Board
data.summary: The purpose of this proposal is to establish a Social Media Editorial Board (EB) for Polkadot that combines structured marketing efficiency with community engagement. The board aims to manage Polkadot's official social media presence in a way that is agile, inclusive, and aligned with the broader goal of decentralization within the ecosystem.

data.ptitle: ink! Analyzer: Retroactive funding for ink! v5 support
data.summary: David Semakula requests retroactive funding to update the ink! analyzer, a semantic analysis library for ink! smart contracts. The update will add ink! v5 features, enhancing IDEs with intelligent editing capabilities for ink! contracts. The proposal covers updating the tool's architecture, adding new features, and ensuring compatibility with ink! v5 syntax.
data.task1: Add architectural foundations for supporting both v4 and v5 language versions across IR, semantic analyzer and language server.
data.task2: Update IR (Intermediate Representation) and attribute parser to support all v5 syntax and entities (including deeply nested meta-items and @ selector values) while preserving legacy support for v4 (also includes unit tests).
data.task3: Add diagnostics and quickfixes for v5 entities and related attribute macros and arguments (while preserving legacy support for v4).
data.task4: Add v5 support for completions, code/intent actions, hover content, inlay hints and signature help (while preserving legacy support for v4).
data.task5: Add v5 codegen (while preserving legacy support for v4).
data.task6: General maintenance and performance improvements.
data.task7: Integration tests (across semantic analyzer, language server and VS Code extension).

data.ptitle: Polkadot Pulse Dubai Edition & Networking Night @ Token2049, Dubai
data.summary: This proposal aims to organize an event called Polkadot Pulse: Dubai Edition. The event brings together a large number of attendees, including ecosystem parachain teams, to showcase projects and engage with the international blockchain community. It will coincide with Token2049 in Dubai, positioning itself as a prominent side event to take advantage of the global blockchain community's presence. The goal is to attract developers, researchers, media, investors, and other stakeholders to foster knowledge sharing and forge new collaborations within the Polkadot ecosystem.
data.task1: Organize Polkadot Pulse - Dubai Edition.

data.ptitle: Parachain Runtime Builder - Treasury
data.summary: The purpose of the Parachain Runtime Builder (PRB) proposal by MVP Workshop is to upgrade the Substrate Starter Kit (SSK) to enhance the process of creating and deploying customized parachains in the Polkadot ecosystem. The updated PRB will provide developers with predefined runtimes, customizable options, and the ability to deploy configurations to a private GitHub repository. It will also include a public API for node operators and Blockchain-as-a-Service entities, enabling 1-click deployment capabilities.

data.task2: Phase 2. â€“ Development of integration-ready API and Interface Enhancements.

The proposal addresses the crypto industry's need for comprehensive research and analytics to inform stakeholders, facilitate informed decision-making, and enhance transparency.

This initiative emphasizes the importance of this participation in enhancing Polkadot's visibility and credibility within the blockchain community, attracting potential partners, developers, and fostering media connections.

data.ptitle: Polkadot Anti-scam Team Bounty Top-up
data.summary: The Anti-Scam Bounty proposal seeks a third top-up to continue its efforts in protecting the Polkadot community from scams. The initiative encourages community participation in reducing scam activities through actions such as taking down malicious sites, creating educational materials, and addressing fake social media channels. The proposal outlines progress made in various tracks focused on administrative operations, education, proactive and reactive measures, and outreach.

data.ptitle: RegionX | Coretime Marketplace for Polkadot
data.summary: RegionX proposes a marketplace on the Polkadot network to lower deployment and operational costs by allowing parachains to procure precisely the Coretime they need. This initiative, split into two development phases, focuses on creating fundamental components for a Coretime marketplace in its first phase. Utilizing the Agile Coretime model, RegionX will offer more flexible Coretime procurement methods. The marketplace will enable the trading of Coretime, represented as NFTs or 'regions', which can be partitioned or interlaced for varied properties
data.task1: Milestone 1: Establishing the Foundation for Coretime Trading.
data.task2: Milestone 2: Developing the Coretime Marketplace Infrastructure.
data.task3: Milestone 3: Finalizing Order Processing and Market Integration.

data.ptitle: Telenova: Polkadot Wallet built into Telegram. Retroactive Funding for 6 months
data.summary: The purpose of this proposal by Novasama Technologies GmbH is to request retroactive funding for the development of a self-custodial Polkadot wallet integrated into Telegram. Telenova aims to simplify the onboarding process for new and web2 users into the Polkadot ecosystem. Its features include user-friendly account creation with Telegram cloud backups, the ability to send tokens directly via Telegram usernames, and fiat currency balance displays, among others. Telenova is designed to lower the barrier to entry for the Polkadot network by leveraging Telegram's extensive user base for mass adoption, providing an accessible and secure wallet services.
data.task1: Self-custodial, cross-platform Polkadot wallet available directly on Telegram.
data.task2: Super simple user-friendly onboarding with Telegram cloud backups.
data.task3: Gifts: Send tokens directly to anyone on Telegram.
data.task5: Send & Receive DOT and KSM tokens to/from any blockchain address.
data.task6: View your Polkadot and Kusama balances in fiat currencies.
data.task7: Balance notifications for your wallet in Telegram.
data.task8: Secured by your personal Telegram cloud with manual account backups.
