data.ptitle: Retroactive Tip for Portuguese Content Creation
data.summary: Uai so serious? is presenting a revised proposal for Polkadot Brasil with a sole focus on retroactive content, aiming to deepen engagement by highlighting past achievements and maintaining consistent content delivery. The strategy includes promoting the Polkadot Brasil Twitter profile through sponsored posts and premium subscriptions. Managed by Uai so serious?, the profile serves as a key community hub. Planned activities include hosting thematic Spaces, publishing original threads, and reaching a significant follower milestone. This initiative will enhance interaction and provide Portuguese-speaking audiences with regular, insightful content about the Polkadot ecosystem.

data.ptitle: Retrospective Funding Proposal of the Polkadot HK Event
data.summary: PolkaWorld seeks retrospective funding for hosting an offline Polkadot Event in Hong Kong. The event aimed to gather Polkadot community members and discuss Polkadot 2.0 and market trends.The requested funds are to cover operational costs for the event.

data.ptitle: Open HRMP Channels between AssetHub and Mythos
data.summary: This is a proposal to open bidirectional HRMP channels between AssetHub (paraId 1000) and Mythos (paraId 3369).

data.ptitle: AMI Bounty Program
data.summary: This proposal seeks to fund an on-chain bounty and assign it a multisig-managed curator. This funding is to be made under a framework established by a Charter ratified by all of the multisig signatories.

data.ptitle: Fund system chains sovereign accounts on Polkadot BridgeHub for Polkadot<>Kusama bridge
data.summary: This proposal suggests initially seeding the P<>K bridge with 10100 DOT and 2030 KSM, split among relevant system chain sovereign accounts, to kickstart its operation, with future operating costs planned to be sustained by user fees from Asset Hub, ensuring profitability and contributing to the treasury in the long run.

data.ptitle: Setting onDemandBaseFee to 0.025 DOT
data.summary: This proposal establishes the minimum fee for a single block order via the on-demand system at 0.025 DOT.

data.ptitle: [Revision] Nomination Pool: Remove max pool and max member limits
data.summary: This proposal removes max pool and max pool member limits.

data.ptitle: Polkadot Runtime Upgrade v1.1.3
data.summary: This is a referendum to upgrade the system to the v1.1.3 Fellowship release.

data.ptitle: Set BEEFY genesis (thus starting BEEFY consensus on Polkadot)
data.summary: This proposal sets BEEFY genesis to the next block after it executes, thus enabling BEEFY consensus on Polkadot.

data.ptitle: Bump parachain validation timeouts
data.summary: This proposal aims to increase the backing timeout on validators from 2s to 2.5s and approval-voting timeout from 12s to 15s respectively.

data.ptitle: Polkadot Ambassador Program
data.summary: The Polkadot Ambassador Program is a group of people who represent Polkadot outside of its existing sphere and help bring new entrants into the Polkadot ecosystem. The program has four ranks: Head Ambassador, Senior Ambassador, Ambassador, and Candidate Ambassador. The Head Ambassadors are the highest ranking group and can only be appointed via general token-holder referendum. The program should have an on-chain Treasury to manage a treasury for salaries, events, and other expenses incurred in fulfilling its objectives. The program should have internal tracks expressing the voice of Head Ambassadors, Senior Ambassadors, and Ambassadors. The Ambassador Program may want to implement changes to how the group operates.

data.ptitle: Polkadot Aligned Sponsorship at ProtoLayers 2024 Conference @ Prague
data.summary: The sponsorship aims to boost Polkadot's visibility within the Ethereum and modular blockchain communities, attract developers, and highlight Polkadotâ€™s architecture. It includes strategic booth placement, branding, media coverage, and social media promotion, plus involvement in networking activities.
data.task1: Organize the Proto Layers conference as a side event to ETHPrague.

data.ptitle: Polkadot Beam Sponsorship at ETHPrague 2024
data.summary: The of this proposal is to to enhance Polkadot's visibility and engagement within the Ethereum community at ETHPrague 2024. The initiative aims to engage attendees through interactive presentations, distribute branded merchandise, and collect potential leads. Glazescape will manage all aspects of the sponsorship, from booth setup to staffing. The team will also produce a comprehensive post-event report to evaluate the sponsorship's effectiveness and inform future strategies.
data.task1: Secure a beam sponsorship at ETHPrague 2024.

data.ptitle: PolkaBiz - Where founders forge investment-ready innovations
data.summary: This initiative aims to to launch a 5-month pilot program that prepares new Polkadot founders for investment readiness, with a culmination event at Polkadot Decoded in Brussels. Created by experienced founders from the Polkadot Blockchain Academy, the program addresses essential business skills needed for success on the Polkadot blockchain, such as articulating value propositions, achieving product-market fit, and securing funding
data.task1: Collaboration and Refinement: Foster successful collaborations with PBA alumni and beyond.
data.task2: Connect with investors: Enable startups to connect with investors in Brussels during Polkadot Decoded.
data.task3: Innovation and Ecosystem Growth: Enable the launch of innovative products on the Polkadot network.
data.task4: Community Building: Cultivate a strong, supportive community of founders within the Polkadot ecosystem.
data.task5: Success Documentation: Document and share success stories and case studies of startups that have succeed with PolkaBiz's support.

data.ptitle: Maintenance & Support Substrate Python API (Jan-Mar 2024)
data.summary: This is a retroactive funding request by the Polkascan Foundation for maintaining the Substrate Python API, including the py-substrate-interface, py-scale-codec, and Python bindings for cryptographic Rust crates, from January to March 2024. The proposal aims to ensure the continued availability and improvement of critical development tools for the Polkadot ecosystem.

data.task2: Updated build pipeline so Github actions also automatically compile aarch64 and musllinux wheels.
data.task3: Updated network endpoints and generated new metadata docs.

data.ptitle: Approval of curators for Bounty 43 (Meetup bounty)
data.summary: The aim of this bounty is to efficiently provide funding for small-scale meetups. The concept revolves around swift processing for smaller funding requests, ensuring a rapid turnaround. The maximum limit per meetup under this bounty is set at $1000.

data.task2: Create 96 clips.
data.task5: Produce 10 interviews.

data.ptitle: TEACHMEDEFI - Growing Polkadotâ€™s Mindshare in the Crypto Space
data.summary: This proposal aims to educate and elevate the awareness of Polkadot in wide audience by creating informative highly quality content. The content strategy is targeting both beginners and experienced users and is designed to correct common misconceptions about Polkadot, increase its visibility outside its immediate ecosystem, and simplify complex features like voting and parachain usage.

data.task5: Introduction to Polkadot: A step-by-step English and German guide (4-5 pages or more), designed to guide users through the essentials of getting started with Polkadot.

data.ptitle: Proposal for Polkadot OpenGov Funding: WEB3DEV Bootcamp for Rust and Pallets Learning
data.summary: The aim of this proposal is to initiate a bootcamp to facilitate developers' entry into the Polkadot ecosystem, focusing on Rust programming and blockchain fundamentals. Leveraging their existing CMS platform, the bootcamp will introduce a detailed curriculum sourced from the open-source rust-state-machine GitHub repository. The course will cover Rust from basic syntax to advanced applications in blockchain development, emphasizing secure and efficient coding practices suitable for Polkadot's Substrate FRAME.

data.task3: Marketing and Outreach: Targeted efforts to engage the Latin America developerâ€™s community and beyond, emphasizing the course's relevance to local and global issues.

These reports are intended to be shared on ProbeLabâ€™s website and the Polkadot community forums, providing dynamic, detailed visualizations of network activity.

This upgrade allows for near real-time responsiveness by directly ingesting unfinalized blocks, enhancing the service's capability.

This technology is intended to create a transparent and quantifiable reputation and work history for each agent by integrating with existing bounties, collectives, and programs. The proposal responds to the need for a standardized method to recognize individual contributions and facilitate the strategic allocation of resources as governance within the ecosystem becomes more decentralized.

data.ptitle: Free Beer Stand & BD/Networking Space at Polkadot Decoded
data.summary: ChaosDAO proposes to enhance Polkadot Decoded by providing a free beer stand and networking space to foster community bonding and business development in a relaxed setting. Located in the venue's lobby, the stand will feature ambient music and standing tables, creating an inviting atmosphere for attendees to socialize and discuss event content. The initiative aims to strengthen community ties and create a memorable experience, with transparent budget management and eco-friendly practices. Funds will be managed by a multi-signature wallet, ensuring accountability and efficiency, with any surplus returned to the treasury.

data.ptitle: A reactive library for building Substrate front-end
data.summary: This proposal outlines the creation of reactive-dot, a React library aimed at simplifying the integration of Polkadot network functionalities into React applications. Inspired by the Wagmi library for Ethereum, reactive-dot will offer intuitive React hooks to facilitate Polkadot interactions, reduce boilerplate code, and enhance the developer experience. Key features include multichain support, React suspense compatibility, and caching. The library aims to promote Polkadot adoption by lowering the entry barrier for developers.
data.task1: Multichain support: Easy chain selection via React context.
data.task2: Reading of storage: Access and read data stored in the Substrate-based storage directly from your React components.
data.task3: React suspense compatibility: React suspense are first class citizen for async & error handling.
data.task4: Caching, deduplication & persistent: Multiple reads of the same value throughout the application will only be fetched once, cached, and is kept up to date everywhere.
data.task5: Full TypeScript support with autocompletion: The library aim to provides strong TypeScript definition with 1-1 mapping to Substrate pallets definition.

data.summary: This is a retroactive proposal for the creation of the RegionX Corehub parachain dashboard, a user-friendly interface designed to simplify the deployment and management of parachains on the Polkadot network. The dashboard provides tools for Coretime procurement, parachain ID reservation, and registration, making the transition from the legacy slot auction model to the Coretime model seamless. Key features include monitoring Coretime expiry, facilitating renewals, and displaying the state of parachains.

data.ptitle: Maintenance for the substrate-api-client Jul-24 to Dec-24
data.summary: This proposal seeks funding for the maintenance of the substrate-api-client from July to December 2024. The substrate-api-client, a Rust library for connecting to a substrate-based node via RPC from no-std environments, is crucial for several ecosystem projects including Ajuna Network, Encointer, Integritee Network, Litentry, and Polkadex. The maintenance will include timely updates to keep pace with the Polkadot ecosystem, user support, and small improvements to enhance functionality. The Supercomputing Systems AG team, based in Zurich, will provide updates, support, and improvements, reporting progress bi-monthly on Polkassembly and tracking it in the GitHub repository.
data.task1: Stay up-to-date with ecosystem needs.
data.task2: Provide support to existing and new users.

data.ptitle: ink! Analyzer: Retroactive funding for ink! 4.x to 5.0 migration features, and other major improvements (56,750 USDT)
data.summary: This proposal seeks retroactive funding for the development of migration features from ink! 4.x to 5.0 in the ink! analyzer tool, along with other major improvements. ink! analyzer, similar to rust-analyzer for Rust, is a collection of libraries and tools for semantic analysis of ink! smart contracts. The proposal includes updates for API migrations, semantic analysis, command and code actions, and general feature enhancements. These improvements support ink! workspace dependencies, improve code completions and actions, and enhance performance and robustness. The proposal aims to fund work done from March 2023 to the final updates post the official ink! v5 release in March 2024.
data.task1: ink! 4.x to 5.0 attribute-based entity migrations.
data.task2: ink! 4.x to 5.0 e2e Client and MessageBuilder API migrations.
data.task3: ink! 4.x to 5.0 semantics-preserving cross-contract host function related API migrations.
data.task4: ink! 4.x to 5.0 migration command and code action, and Cargo.toml migration.
data.task5: General ink! 5.0 additions and improvements.
data.task6: General robustness and feature improvements.
data.task7: Integration tests (across semantic analyzer, language server and VS Code extension).

data.ptitle: Open-Source Registrar Development Continuity
data.summary: This proposal aims to develop and maintain open-source tools necessary for enabling automated registrar services on the Kusama People parachain and facilitating its launch on Polkadot. It includes reworking existing tools (polkadot-registrar-watcher and polkadot-registrar-challenger) to ensure compatibility with the Polkadot People system parachain, enhancing user and developer experience. The project also seeks to broaden media verification adoption through a bridge-manager to matrix, enabling verification across various social media platforms. Key objectives include maintaining and enhancing registrar tools, integrating verification systems, and developing a user-friendly interface for identity creation and verification.
data.task1: Initial Setup and Environment Preparation.
data.task2: Enhance polkadot-registrar-watcher.
data.task5: Documentation and Initial Testing.

data.ptitle: Verified Organization Badges on Twitter/X for Parachains, Top Wallets & Comms Channels
data.summary: This proposal requests 12 months of funding for 41 Verified Organization Badges on X/Twitter, managed by the Social Media Board through its auxiliary, Evan. The Web3 Foundation (W3F) previously covered these costs, but as marketing is now decentralized, the Treasury is being asked to fund the badges, which benefit the community and parachains. Currently, 36 accounts have badges, and this proposal will expand that to 47, including additional parachains and ecosystem wallets, with W3F continuing to pay for six specific accounts. The Verified Organization Badges offer numerous benefits such as priority visibility, impersonation defense, premium support, and more. The Social Media Editorial Board has set criteria for badge allocation to ensure effective management. Invoices will be sent to W3F, with compensation provided from the funds of this proposal.
data.task1: Ensure the verified organization badge on Twitter/X for 41 accounts.

data.ptitle: Polkadot London Event - Dawn of RWAs
data.summary: The proposal seeks to boost understanding and investment in Polkadot technology through a London event, showcasing its real-world applications and interoperability. Attendees will include key figures from Parity, PBA, ecosystem project teams, VCs, investors, real estate developers, and legal professionals. The event will feature networking, presentations, and a panel discussion to highlight Polkadot's capabilities and attract more investment from Europe's financial hub. It aims to simplify Polkadot's understanding, foster investment, and initiate regular Polkadot meetups in London.
data.task1: Promote Polkadot in London Event.

data.ptitle: Bringing Stellar Liquidity to Polkadot: Loan DOT Collateral for Pendulumâ€™s Spacewalk Bridge Vaults
data.summary: The proposal's goal is to secure 50,000 DOT from the Polkadot treasury as collateral for bridging stablecoins from the Stellar ecosystem to Polkadot, enhancing liquidity and interoperability via the Spacewalk bridge. The DOT will be staked on Bifrost, with vDOT used as collateral for the bridge, involving a one-year lock-up period and return of the DOT by July 2025. The initiative also aims to decentralize the bridge security network through staking rewards to incentivize external vaults.
data.task1: Lock the vDot collateral for one year to enhance liquidity.

data.ptitle: Ecosystem Test Environment Bounty
data.summary: This proposal seeks funding to develop a testing environment to enhance system upgrade procedures and minimize feature regression. It aims to establish a dedicated test environment for automatic testing, inspired by successful frameworks like Acala Networkâ€™s e2e-tests. Key objectives include integrating the ability to override WASM binaries, supporting forks from specific relay chain blocks, and providing a set of basic testing scenarios. Automated nightly tests will ensure scenarios remain functional, and a notification system will promptly inform teams of any issues. The project involves establishing a framework for writing testing scenarios, integrating runtime replacements, and ensuring comprehensive documentation. Curated by the Polkadot Technical Fellowship, the project invites contributions from developers and parachain teams to create a robust ecosystem-wide testing environment.

data.ptitle: Polkadot Ecosystem vCISO Program w/Spearbit
data.summary: This proposal seeks funding for an initiative to provide subsidized virtual Chief Information Security Officer (vCISO) services to Polkadot parachain teams and top Polkadot Blockchain Academy (PBA) graduates. Spearbit/Cantina will offer 533 hours of security and advisory services, including architecture reviews, risk assessments, and security best practices, to enhance the security and resilience of participating projects. The goal is to increase the complexity and cost of launching attacks against the Polkadot ecosystem, thereby improving trust and security. The initiative will also foster connections with leading security experts, further securing the DOT ecosystem. Regular progress reports and milestones will ensure transparency and effectiveness.
data.task1: Introduction calls between Spearbit/Cantina and PBA or existing Parachain project.
data.task2: Provide the signed vCISO SOWs between project and Spearbit/Cantina, which state scope of work, itemized pricing, and subsidized amount.
data.task3: Review protocols that release on Mainnet to increase user activity for DOT.
data.task4: Receive approval for vCISO for PBA proposal.
data.task5: Engage with PBA projects after program concludes to discuss near-term security needs and efforts.

data.ptitle: Developer tools for Polkadot-API
data.summary: LimeChain proposes the development of a new developer tools application using the Polkadot-API (PAPI) to enhance the developer experience on Polkadot. The project aims to create a dedicated integrated development environment (IDE) and real-time exploration tools. The application will include features such as a PAPI Sandbox IDE for rapid prototyping, a real-time block explorer, and interfaces for chain state, RPC, and runtime calls. Additionally, it will provide a SCALE encoder and decoder. The project will be open-sourced under the Apache 2.0 license. Key deliverables include UX/UI designs, the block explorer, PAPI Sandbox IDE, and the SCALE encoding/decoding page.
data.task1: Kick-off and UI/UX Design.
data.task2: Setup Next.js, UI, Home page.
data.task5: DevOps.
data.task6: Real-time block explorer page.
data.task7: Chain state.

data.ptitle: Proposal: Funding for Design and Development of XCQ, the Cross-Consensus Query Language
data.summary: This proposal requests funding to develop the Cross-Consensus Query Language (XCQ), a framework for querying on-chain information across different blockchain networks. Spearheaded by the Acala team, XCQ aims to improve developers' workflows and user experiences within the Polkadot ecosystem. The project includes designing and developing XCQ to provide a standardized way to query data across chains, which can be integrated into XCM or used as a standalone runtime API. Key features include using PolkaVM for execution, an extension-based design for flexibility, and a built-in meta type system. The proposal outlines milestones for research, specification, implementation, SDK development, and extension creation, aiming to enhance cross-chain interactions for various use cases such as querying balances, staking rewards, and asset prices.
data.task1: M1: Research and create XCQ spec draft with PoC .
data.task2: M2: Stabilize XCQ spec with end-to-end demo.
data.task4: M4: XCQ pallet and runtime library.
data.task5: M5: XCQ SDK and example dApp and documentations.
data.task6: M6: XCQ extensions for common features.

data.ptitle: DOTphin Event Multipass by Sovereign Nature with WalletConnect integration & upgradeable, dynamic NFTs by Unique Network
data.summary: Sovereign Nature Initiative proposes the DOTphin Event Multipass, integrating WalletConnect and dynamic NFTs by Unique Network, to enhance user experience and unify proof of attendance NFTs for Polkadot events. This initiative addresses the fragmentation of event NFTs by introducing DOTphin, an evolving avatar companion linked to real-world biodiversity data. Attendees at selected events will receive dynamic soul-bound tokens that evolve with engagement, offering real-life perks and access to special activities. The project includes seamless wallet integration, leveraging WalletConnect's advanced technology to improve user onboarding and cross-chain opportunities. Additionally, a portion of the budget supports conservation efforts, emphasizing Polkadot's commitment to sustainability.

The campaign will use 91 digital screens across 41 buildings, featuring 10-second animations with an 8% share of time over 5.5 months, aiming to expose 47.9K employees to Polkadot advertisements. It focuses on sectors like banking, financial services, asset management, software and gaming companies, and creative agencies, targeting notable companies such as JP Morgan, HSBC, Citibank, Barclays, KPMG, Vanguard, Fitch Ratings, Citadel, Deutsche Boerse, Stripe, Twitch, Pay UK, and Ripple.

data.ptitle: Open source alternative to centralized polkadot API gateways and node as a service
data.summary: Kotal proposes an open-source Node as a Service and API gateway for Polkadot, parachains, and future JAM applications. The goal is to provide a decentralized alternative to centralized API gateways like OnFinality. Kotal allows users to deploy and manage blockchain nodes on various cloud infrastructures with features such as node deployment, validator key management, resource monitoring, secure API endpoints, and real-time notifications. The proposal includes extending capabilities to support system parachain nodes and collators for Polkadot and Kusama chains, adding webhook notifications, data snapshots, and validator session key management. Kotal is backed by ConsenSys Ventures, Protocol Labs, and SOSV dLab, with a team experienced in blockchain development. The funding will support the implementation of these features and further development of the platform.

data.ptitle: Referendum #819 for the Polkadot UX Bounty
data.summary: The proposal aims to introduce a bounty to enhance the user experience (UX) within the Polkadot ecosystem. It addresses fragmented user experiences and the lack of a unified UX strategy, which hinder user engagement and adoption. The proposal suggests implementing UX best practices, creating a Common Good Design Library, and adopting systematic project management to ensure cohesive and intuitive interfaces across Polkadot dapps and services. The initiative will be managed by Braille, a Web3 UX/UI agency, and overseen by a diverse group of curators. The goal is to make Polkadot more user-friendly, competitive, and accessible, ultimately fostering broader ecosystem adoption.

data.ptitle: Polkadot Business Development in Brazil - Continuation of Operations

The team has been successful in building strong foundations in Brazil since 2021 by organizing meetups, conferences, and corporate events, which significantly increased the visibility and integration of Polkadot's technology. The proposal aims to transition the BD teamâ€™s focus from rapid market penetration to maintaining and nurturing existing commercial partnerships. This includes educational initiatives, partnerships with universities, constant account management, and consultancy to help businesses integrate Polkadotâ€™s blockchain technology. The proposal also highlights Brazil's significant potential in the cryptocurrency market and the team's strategy to position Polkadot as a leading blockchain ecosystem in the region. The BD team will receive a stable remuneration model to support ongoing relationships and foster new leads.

data.ptitle: Proposal: Establish the Polkadot Community Foundation to represent DOT holders IRL
data.summary: The proposal seeks to establish the Polkadot Community Foundation in the Cayman Islands to act as a legal entity representing DOT holders' interests off-chain. Designed by Actum Node LLC and community members, the Foundation will execute real-world activities directed by Polkadot OpenGov. Initially, it will focus on creating and maintaining an off-chain organization, managing assets, and executing contracts. The Foundation will be governed by a five-member Board of Directors, with three professional directors from the Cayman Islands and two appointed by Polkadot governance. A supervisor will oversee the Board to ensure compliance with the Foundation's governing documents.

data.ptitle: Events Bounty Top Up Proposal
data.summary: This proposal seeks a 1 million DOT top-up for the Events Bounty with changes in structure and compensation to enhance efficiency. The updates include removing the cost cap on extraordinary events, stricter approval timelines, introducing fishermen, and proactive speaker funding. The new structure will include curators, advisors, subcurators, and fishermen, each with specific roles to ensure smooth operations and event quality. The aim is to unify Polkadotâ€™s global events strategy, boost community growth, and position Polkadot at key industry events. The proposal also outlines a new strike system for curators and detailed rules for event funding and reporting, ensuring transparency and accountability.

data.ptitle: Incognitee: Privacy Sidechain on Paseo (Retroactive)
data.summary: Integritee AG proposes a retroactive funding request for the development and deployment of Incognitee, a privacy-enhancing sidechain technology for Polkadot, Kusama, and other Substrate-based chains. The proposal also includes a soft-loan agreement to repay the treasury using a portion of future fee revenues.

data.ptitle: Subsquid - Public data indexing Infrastructure for Polkadot and Kusama (Q4 2023)
data.summary: Subsquid Labs GmbH requests funding to cover maintenance costs for its public Subsquid Archives and the Giant Squid API. These services provide crucial infrastructure for the Polkadot and Kusama ecosystems by offering access to on-chain data in GraphQL format for numerous parachains. Subsquid Archives serve as a data source for various projects, including wallets, explorers, and dApps, enabling efficient data exploration and query execution. The Giant Squid API, an open-source GraphQL API set, supports data access for Polkadot, Kusama, and major parachains.
data.task1: Ongoing development and maintenance costs for public Subsquid Archives and the Giant Squid API

data.ptitle: dAppForge - AI powered plug-in for Polkadot developers that reduces development time.
data.summary: The dAppForge project seeks to enhance the developer experience on Polkadot by providing an AI-powered plug-in designed to simplify and accelerate development using Substrate and ink!. The project addresses the challenges developers face with Polkadot's complex frameworks by offering tailored code suggestions, error handling, and natural language prompts. This proposal requests funding for Milestone 2, which focuses on refining the AI model, integrating support for ink!, and adding a chat feature to the plug-in.
data.task1: Fine-tune the current AI model for substrate to provide better code completion.
data.task2: Integrate ink! Into the model.

data.ptitle: Reactive DOT: funding request for continuation of development
data.summary: This proposal seeks continued funding for the development of the Reactive DOT library, which simplifies and enhances the development of Substrate-based decentralized applications (DApps). Reactive DOT provides a set of front-end functions and utilities designed to reduce boilerplate code, making it easier for developers to interact with Substrate chains. It supports TypeScript with strong IntelliSense, caching, multichain support, and wallet management, including compatibility with popular wallets like Polkadot.js, SubWallet, and WalletConnect.
data.task1: Maintenance.
data.task2: Improvements of existing features pending feedback.
data.task4: Support for additional frameworks, starting with Vue.
data.task5: Research and development into hybrid SSR and client updates.
data.task6: Features requested by the community.

data.ptitle: Phink â€“ ink! fuzzer for security and robustness
data.summary: This proposal requests funding for the development of Phink, a sophisticated fuzzing tool for ink! smart contracts on the Polkadot blockchain. Developed by Security Research Labs, Phink aims to enhance the security and reliability of smart contracts by using advanced coverage-guided fuzzing techniques and smart mutations to detect vulnerabilities. The tool will be compatible with multiple ink! versions and custom runtimes, allowing for broad applicability across the ecosystem. The project will be open-source, encouraging community contributions and ongoing improvements, ultimately contributing to the robustness and security of decentralized applications within the Polkadot ecosystem.
data.task1: M1: Project Setup.
data.task2: M2: Base ink! fuzzing harness development.
data.task5: M5: Blockchain state tracking.
data.task6: M6: Performance evaluation.
data.task7: M7: User interface development.

data.ptitle: Polkadot User Segments & Conversions for Ink!, Pallets & XCM
data.summary: This proposal requests funding for the development of a no-code user segmentation and conversion tool by Tokenguard. The tool aims to enhance user analytics for Polkadot and Kusama ecosystems, enabling DeFi, dApp, wallet, and parachain builders to better understand user behavior, improve user retention, and optimize strategies for increasing revenue and minimizing churn. The tool will offer cross-protocol and cross-chain tracking, allowing for the segmentation of wallets based on on-chain activity, conversions, and interactions across various protocols.

data.ptitle: PROPOSAL - FHE-WASM Research and Development for the Polkadot Ecosystem
data.summary: This proposal seeks funding for the research and development of Fully Homomorphic Encryption (FHE) capabilities for WebAssembly (WASM) on the Polkadot ecosystem. The project, led by a team of four Ph.D. researchers and developers, aims to implement FHE on the WASM instruction set, enhancing privacy and security for smart contracts and applications. The project will provide an FHE-WASM module and a key-sharing solution, with the ultimate goal of creating a comprehensive FHE solution for the Polkadot ecosystem.
data.task1: Research.
data.task2: Plan & Documentation.
data.task5: Key Storage.

data.ptitle: Dot Play Bounty
data.summary: This proposal seeks funding to establish Dot Play as a gaming accelerator within the Polkadot ecosystem, aimed at positioning Polkadot as the leading blockchain for gaming. Building on previous successes, Dot Play will leverage its extensive network, including game studios, developers, and industry experts, to drive the adoption of Polkadot's infrastructure in the gaming industry. The initiative focuses on high-growth gaming genres and user-generated content platforms to maximize audience engagement. Dot Play will provide strategic support, technical integration, and business development to onboard gaming projects onto Polkadot, ensuring long-term sustainability and ecosystem growth.

data.ptitle: Snowbridge Launch and Treasury Proposal
data.summary: This proposal requests funding to support Snowbridge, the first fully trustless Polkadot-Ethereum bridge, following the completion of major milestones. Key components include retroactive and future audit costs, sponsorship for light client relayer operations, and vesting payments for completed engineering milestones. The proposal is designed to align the Snowbridge team's incentives with the success and security of the Polkadot ecosystem.

data.ptitle: KAGOME â€“ the C++ implementation of Polkadot Host milestone 3
data.summary: This proposal seeks funding for the third milestone of the KAGOME project, a C++ implementation of the Polkadot Host, aimed at enhancing client diversity, security, and performance within the Polkadot ecosystem. KAGOME already participates in Kusama relay chain validation and brings alternative client options to reduce the risks associated with a single implementation. The proposal outlines work on critical features such as elastic scaling, validation protocol upgrades, systematic chunks, and various security enhancements. The proposal also includes ongoing security assurance by SRLabs to ensure the robustness of the KAGOME implementation, with technical support and oversight provided by the Web3 Foundation.
data.task1: Security improvements.

data.summary: This proposal aims to approve Bounty 59 proposing the establishment of an Open Source Developer Grants Program to support individuals and small teams in developing open-source software for the Polkadot ecosystem.

data.ptitle: PlutoWallet 1st proposal: Account abstraction, Full featured NFT support, Transaction Analyzer
data.summary: PlutoWallet requests funding for its first milestone to enhance its mobile application for the Polkadot ecosystem. This wallet aims to provide comprehensive NFT support and utilize Account Abstraction for improved user experience and security. Key features include custom wallet layouts, seamless integration with various dApps, cross-chain multisignature accounts, and advanced NFT functionalities. The proposal also includes developing a Transaction Analyzer to identify potential security threats and optimize performance.
data.task1: Account Abstraction.
data.task2: Full featured NFT support.

data.ptitle: Deposit DOT into parachain child accounts to accelerate opening XCM channels
data.summary: This proposal requests funding to deposit into the Child accounts of 14 parachains, facilitating the opening of XCM channels between chains. The aim is to make it easier for non-DeFi parachains to establish bidirectional XCM channels by providing the necessary DOT deposits, removing the need for teams to convert their tokens or manage complex XCM calls. This initiative addresses the lack of XCM channels on several parachains, which limits accessibility to parachain tokens in Polkadot DeFi and hinders cross-chain integration.
data.task1: Deposit into the Child accounts of 14 parachains, facilitating the opening of XCM channels between chains.

The project aims to build upon its current functionalities, including system parachain integration, improved Ledger and WalletConnect support, UX improvements, and developer and user documentation updates. The proposal outlines tasks such as light client support, Linux build compatibility, enhanced extrinsic capabilities, and data backup features.

data.ptitle: 50 Polkadot Ecosystem PR campaigns in the most influential media
data.summary: Chainwire seeks funding to support continued PR and marketing efforts for projects within the Polkadot ecosystem. Following a successful campaign that generated 1,180 press releases and 22.7 million impressions for 24 Polkadot projects, Chainwire aims to expand its services, offering at least 50 Premium campaigns over six months. Each campaign will publish around 75 articles across over 150 major crypto, financial, and tech media outlets.
data.task1: Execute 50 Premium campaigns. Each campaign will publish around 75 articles across over 150 major crypto, financial, and tech media outlets.

data.ptitle: ink! 5.0 Codebase Security Audit
data.summary: This proposal requests funding for a comprehensive security audit of the ink! 5.0 smart contract programming language. Conducted by SRLabs in collaboration with Parity Security, the audit will focus on identifying vulnerabilities and providing recommendations to enhance the security and resilience of ink! smart contracts. The audit will cover the ink! 5.0 codebase, storage layers, and selected open-source contracts using dynamic testing and manual reviews. It will also include developing a threat model, remediation support, a detailed audit report, and educational materials for secure development practices. The findings will be publicly shared to benefit the Polkadot community and support the ongoing growth and adoption of ink! within the ecosystem.
data.task1: Threat model.
data.task2: Code audit.
data.task5: Ecosystem blog post.

data.ptitle: AssetPortal (Milestone 1)
data.summary: The Asset Portal team requests funding to develop a user-friendly portal that simplifies asset management through the Polkadot Asset Hub. The project will be completed in two 6-month milestones: developing an MVP that supports token transfers, swaps, bridging, DeFi exploration, NFTs, and asset management, followed by fine-tuning and maintenance. The portal aims to unify and streamline user interactions within the Polkadot ecosystem, enhancing user experience and driving adoption. Open-source and focused on security, Asset Portal will facilitate collaboration, customization, and integration across projects and parachains.
data.task1: MVP
data.task2: Asset Portal dApp

data.ptitle: EasyA x Polkadot - Developer Growth via In-Person Hackathons and Crash Courses (#180DaysOfPolkadot): Milestones 1 & 2 Report
data.summary: This proposal seeks retroactive funding for the completion of Milestone 2 of the #180DaysOfPolkadot initiative, a developer education campaign by EasyA. The campaign achieved significant results, including over 110,000 developers starting the course, 650 in-person hackathon participants, and 111 new projects. Collaborations with 12 parachains and stakeholders were critical to its success. The requested funding will cover the final costs of in-person events, prize distribution, and educational campaigns.

PBA aims to expand its reach, having already educated over 400 developers in its two-year history. PBA-X is designed to be an online course that will scale the academy's impact by educating thousands of new developers and introducing a new DApps track.  Additionally, the PBA will grow university partnerships and maintain continuous learning initiatives for its alumni community to support long-term ecosystem growth.

data.ptitle: *UPDATED* Proposal for the Polkadot Community to Earn RWA Yield on Idle Stablecoins via Centrifuge
data.summary: This proposal suggests that the Polkadot Community Foundation deploy 1.5 million USDC into Centrifuge's Anemoy Liquid Treasury Fund, a pool that invests in U.S. Treasury Bills to earn stable yield. The goal is to grow Polkadot's total value locked (TVL), generate returns on idle treasury funds, and support the broader adoption of real-world assets (RWAs) within the Polkadot ecosystem. The investment will be managed through XCM and follows an earlier investment by the Web3 Foundation into the same fund. T-Bills, being low-risk and highly liquid, offer a secure means for Polkadot to diversify its treasury while maintaining financial flexibility.
data.task1: Deploy 1.5 million USDC into Centrifuge's Anemoy Liquid Treasury Fund, to earn stable yield and grow Polkadot's total value locked (TVL), generate returns on treasury funds, and support the broader adoption of real-world assets (RWAs) within the Polkadot ecosystem.

SubWallet is a non-custodial wallet designed for the Polkadot and Kusama ecosystems, supporting over 150 networks and providing users with tools to manage, stake, and transfer assets across multiple chains. The proposal highlights the team's focus on continuous development and improvements, driving ecosystem growth and enhancing user experience.

data.ptitle: Cyborg Network: Unlocking the Web 2.5 potential of Polkadot with Blockchain powered Edge Computing
data.summary: This proposal seeks funding to develop and launch Cyborg Network, a blockchain-powered edge computing platform designed to bridge web2 and web3, focusing on AI and low-latency applications. The aim is to onboard enterprise and web2 users into the Polkadot ecosystem through a decentralized infrastructure that supports AI compute tasks, application deployment, and large-scale data storage. The Cyborg parachain will leverage partnerships with data centers and edge computing providers to offer scalable, secure services, while blockchain technology ensures decentralized governance, data security, and efficient task distribution. The project also plans to develop JAM-Boost, a tool to deploy and manage Polkadot edge nodes, facilitating infrastructure decentralization.

data.ptitle: sub0 RESET @Devcon Bangkok - back to the roots

The event, organized by WebZero, will include a three-day conference, evening events, a 72-hour hacker space, workshops, and challenges for developers. The focus is on Substrate, the core technology powering blockchains like Starknet, Cardano, and Polygon, with Polkadot being a primary contributor. The event will coincide with Devcon in Bangkok to maximize attendance, with plans for transparent budgeting, sponsor partnerships, and a focus on onboarding new developers to Substrate.

data.ptitle: Showcasing Polkadotâ€™s Capabilities: The Spammening
data.summary: The proposal by Amforc aims to demonstrate Polkadot's scalability by filling blocks with transactions for approximately 30 minutes, showcasing its high theoretical transactions per second (TPS) in a real-world setting. This experiment involves generating thousands of addresses and sending DOT between them to fully utilize block capacity, filling 75% of Polkadot's blocks. The goal is to highlight Polkadotâ€™s ability to handle high throughput compared to other blockchains. After the test, the existential deposits (EDs) will be recovered, and any remaining funds, including unused DOT for transaction fees, will be returned to the Polkadot Treasury.
data.task1: Fill the Polkadot blocks with transactions to showcase Polkadot's ability to handle high throughput compared to other blockchains.

The proposed package is expected to simplify development for web3 projects and increase the ecosystem's security by reducing reliance on single-package implementations.

The project aims to extend Polkadot's functionality to include native data storage, bringing it closer to the vision of a fully integrated supercomputer ecosystem.

data.ptitle: Referendum #1322: Rebond DOT from Parallel Fi accounts - Description below
data.summary: A malicious account exploited Parallel Fi governance, upgrading the parachain's runtime to gain administrative control and transferring DOT and USDT assets to themselves. The account used a custom sudo pallet to execute these actions, transferring funds across multiple parachains to obscure the trail. They are actively unstaking additional DOT through proxies, complicating recovery efforts. This proposal seeks to issue a whitelisted rebond call to restake the DOT, effectively extending the unstaking period by 28 days. This extension would provide Parallel Fi's team with critical time to explore solutions for regaining control of its parachain governance and addressing the security breach.

data.ptitle: Treasury Proposal: Funding for Enhancing Substrate Fast Sync for Large Chain States
data.summary: This proposal aims to enhance Substrate's fast sync capabilities by addressing critical challenges in handling large chain states and improving reliability. Currently, Substrateâ€™s state sync faces Out-of-Memory (OOM) issues when importing large states, and lacks persistent progress tracking, requiring restarts after interruptions. These limitations impact the usability of advanced sync strategies, including decentralized Bitcoin fast sync, as demonstrated in the Subcoin project funded by a previous Web3 Foundation grant. The proposed solution involves refactoring the state import logic to handle data more efficiently at the database layer and introducing mechanisms to resume interrupted sync processes.
data.task1: Refactoring State Import Logic.
data.task2: Implementing Persistent State Sync.

data.ptitle: Infrastructure Funding for Polkadot Asset Hub #3 - Atomic swaps, Offers, Maintenance
data.summary: This proposal aims to enhance the Polkadot Asset Hub by implementing atomic swaps for secure, trustless peer-to-peer NFT trading, an offers system to allow bids on unlisted assets, and providing 12 months of maintenance. These additions aim to improve market liquidity, user engagement, and overall trading capabilities while maintaining an open-source approach. The Kodadot team, a leading developer in the Polkadot NFT ecosystem, plans to leverage its expertise in NFT infrastructure, APIs, and decentralized solutions to deliver these features. The outlined milestones include feature implementation, infrastructure updates, and ongoing maintenance, with regular progress reports and transparency through public repositories.
data.task1: Offers Implementation.
data.task2: Atomic Swaps Implementation.
data.task5: Maintenance.

data.ptitle: Publishing and promoting the documentary, â€œBlockchain Gaming,â€ by the Polkadot community.
data.summary: This proposal seeks funding to publish and promote the documentary Blockchain Gaming, which explores the intersection of gaming and blockchain technology, with a focus on Polkadot's ecosystem. The documentary features interviews with developers, indie creators, and blockchain experts, addressing key questions about the relevance and potential of blockchain gaming. It aims to educate and inspire developers and users, showcasing Polkadot as a leader in gaming innovation.
data.task1: Create a documentary about Gaming on Blockchain.

data.ptitle: Talisman Wallet and Portal Retroactive Funding
data.summary: Talisman is a user-friendly, open-source wallet designed for the Polkadot ecosystem, offering advanced portfolio management, account organization, staking features, and cross-chain functionalities. The accompanying Talisman Portal simplifies user interaction with Polkadot by providing a centralized interface for activities like staking, swaps, and ecosystem exploration. During this period, Talisman released 34 software updates addressing key areas such as in-wallet staking, enhanced hardware wallet support, cross-chain swaps, and improved user experience. The proposal highlights Talismanâ€™s contributions to the ecosystem, including support for the Generic Ledger app, expanded staking options, and continuous support for new Polkadot features.
